item.title: New Licton Springs Community Council website
item.description:
For the last month work has been going on behind the scenes to refresh the Licton Springs Community Council Website, and I'm excited to say this new site is ready to be unveiled! You can now visit the brand new website at lictonsprings.org.

The community council has been the …
item.dc:creator: timothycrosley

item.title: Your Voice, Your Choice 2018: Licton Springs Park
item.description:
It's time to VOTE for your favorite park and street improvements!

Voting for the 2018 Your Voice, Your Choice: Parks and Streets is now live and a proposal for improvements at Licton Springs Park (project 18-5001) is listed as one of the options for District 5!

As part of the …
item.dc:creator: amandacrosley

item.title: Mineral Springs Park Community Meeting
item.description:
UPDATE: The meeting was originally set to start at 7 PM but was then changed to a 6 PM start time by Seattle Parks and Recreation.

Join other members of the community on May 1st, 6:00PM-8:30PM, to help shape the future of Mineral Springs park! The meeting will …
item.dc:creator: timothycrosley

item.title: Licton Spring's P-Patch: Bringing Community Together
item.description:
It's officially spring time and with the warmer weather brings sunshine and blooming flowers. Did you know that Licton Springs has a community p-patch at College Way & North 92nd St?

What is a P-Patch?

P-Patch is the name given to community gardens that are managed by the Seattle P-Patch Community …
item.dc:creator: amandacrosley

item.title: An early preview of Spring in Licton Springs
item.description: In hopefully an early preview of what Spring has to offer this year, Licton Springs Park was a beautiful sight this weekend backdropped by clear Seattle skies.
item.dc:creator: timothycrosley
